Turns his back to the noisy poker table to focus on the serious phone call about his brother being shot, showing sensitivity to the gravity of the situation.
Shares the tragic news with Rosario Diaz and accepts her support, allowing himself to be vulnerable and open to others.
Stops the poker game abruptly and insists everyone leave so he can attend to his family emergency, showing responsibility and consideration of priorities.
Maintains composure when receiving shocking news, quickly decides to end the game and leave to be with his family.
Momentarily frozen and stunned after hearing that his brother was shot, showing momentary loss of control.
Touches his father's arm and expresses concern, asking if he is all right.
Follows his father after being emotionally rebuffed, showing persistence despite rejection.
Charges past the Guard, initiating a messy struggle to reach his brother.
Acknowledges Sandra's subtle communication with a subtle nod and mouthed 'THANK YOU,' showing awareness and reading the situation.
Pauses before entering the ward, indicating thoughtfulness and caution.
Expresses strong emotion and heartbreak upon seeing his brother's condition, momentarily losing composure.
Leans over haltingly, kisses his brother's forehead, showing tenderness and care.
Emotionally distraught, seeking comfort from Rosario, showing vulnerability and trust.
Expresses guilt quietly ('Feels like it was my fault...'), sincere and self-reflective.
Sinks down holding Rosario tight, head at her stomach, showing need for closeness and emotional warmth.
Kisses Rosario on her forehead in a public place, affectionate and tender.
Gently backs away when visiting hours are over, showing respect for rules and boundaries.
Notices two teens smoking crack but does not intervene or react impulsively, suggesting situational awareness.
Struggles to express emotions and gropes for words, emotionally vulnerable and uncertain.
Physically sinks down and clings to Rosario like a child, indicating emotional overwhelm and lack of control.
Urgently pushes through crowd to find Deputy Chief Grusinsky to deliver important information about his father.
Touches his father's arm to get attention and pulls him aside privately to share critical information.
Provides crucial information about the hit list and confirms the threat calmly and quietly.
Does not attempt to escalate the situation impulsively, indicating measured judgment.
Sees an opening in a difficult situation and suggests using a shipment to get to Nezhinski, showing strategic thinking.
Admits somewhat sheepishly that they've been wanting him to buy in for a while, indicating some hesitance or insecurity.
Questions Burt when told to forget the setup plan, showing engagement and willingness to understand the plan fully.
Leans over and kisses Rosario Diaz, offering comfort by telling her to go back to sleep.
Hesitates but then offers to make a confidential connection to help Michael Solo and Jack with their tactical plan.
Negotiates a high starting price ($50k) confidently and agrees to a risky meeting next day.
Takes a symbolic gesture seriously, acknowledges the cost of the call, and proceeds cautiously by accepting the beeper.
Asks seriously for a promise to protect his girlfriend, showing forethought and tact.
Ignores cops' attempts to communicate before negotiating, indicating self-control and focus.
Peacefully accepts Michael's affectionate gesture by allowing Michael to grab his shoulder.
Listens to Rosario's caring and loving phone message from the answering machine.
Takes out his savings from the drawer after hearing Rosario's message.
Expresses concern about being left alone during a risky deal (asks Man #1 if he's going to be left alone).
Responds to a tense situation by quickly checking the beeper and following through on a covert exchange with a man, showing awareness and caution.
Questions the man when left alone for the deal, indicating some insecurity but also a prudent understanding of the risk.
Fires the lighter successfully when handed to him.
Makes a sarcastic comment to Man #1, showing some confidence or bravado.
Grasps the lighter tightly, looks paranoid and harried, indicating emotional stress.
Decides to inform and help police set up Nezhinski, showing resolve and a willingness to take intelligent action.
Appears almost in tears and does not respond to Rosario’s conversational cues, indicating emotional overwhelm and lack of control.
Stands alone waiting in the cold, uses a listening device to check surroundings, silently tries to contact someone on the phone, then hangs up upon arrival of Pavel's car.
Surveys the unfamiliar and ominous environment calmly, paying attention to key details like people, objects, and surroundings.
Passively allows others to put masks on him and lead him without questioning or resisting.
Accepts a drug offered to him by Pavel and uses it despite clear danger signs.
Sees his chance and charges backward to escape imminent death.
Throws himself out a window despite the danger, showing determination and quick decision-making.
Survives a fall through a window, sustaining injuries but escaping capture or death.
Greets partygoers with friendly hellos and receives respectful treatment from them.
Puts his arm around Rosario, showing a protective or affectionate gesture in public.
Engages warmly with Deputy Commissioner Spiro Giavannis, shaking hands enthusiastically and responding with modest humor.
Downplays his injury with self-deprecating humor and shifts attention to his brother’s worse condition, showing humility and concern for others.
Offers to be available if needed and listens to Burt Grusinsky's concerns quietly.
Shows concern for someone returning to work too soon, implying care for their well-being.
Respectfully declines Burt's offer to join the Department out of loyalty to his own plans.
Nods a 'hello' to guard Vitt as a polite acknowledgement.
Furiously looking for Rosario, shouting 'WHERE THE FUCK IS SHE?!?'.
Motions to his bodyguard clearly to leave, shows decisiveness.
Arrives at the motel and immediately checks his room, shows awareness and responsibility.
Reacts with fury when Rosario is missing, indicating frustration but not necessarily control or calmness.
Calmly manages a tense situation by asserting control and insisting on leaving due to danger.
Clearly prioritizes safety over fun, showing good judgment about the environment.
Firmly interrupts a conversation to focus on urgent matters, demonstrating decisiveness.
Fails to immediately convince Rosario to cooperate, requiring repeated commands and physical following.
Tenderly puts his hand on her face; offers reassurance with 'Let's go back--this'll all be over soon. I promise...'
Visits Marat Buzhayev to express condolences and explain his decision not to stay in New York anymore
Takes Rosario's hand as they travel together in the car.
Puts his arm around Rosario in the back seat during difficult weather conditions.
Focused and silent rather than responsive when Rosario talks about her watch.
Remains focused on his father's car despite heavy rain and poor visibility during a tense convoy.
Notices a suspicious Oldsmobile driving alongside their vehicle indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Does not respond to Rosario's remark about leaving her watch, prioritizing focus on the situation.
Pushes Rosario's head down into the back seat to protect her from gunfire.
Takes control of the wheel and maneuvers the car to avoid danger, prioritizing passengers' safety.
Pulls up beside Burt and tells him to lay back on the radio, indicating caution and concern for safety.
Freezes in disbelief and horror as he watches his father, Burt, get shot, showing emotional vulnerability and care.
His car peels away from danger, prioritizing safety after witnessing the shooting.
Pulls up beside Burt and tells him over the radio to lay back, trying to coordinate the action.
Freezes in disbelief and horror after Burt is shot, losing control of the situation at a critical moment.
Nods speechlessly to Rosario's request to call her mother, showing silent support.
Shows visible emotional pain and cries quietly after learning about his brother's condition.
Insists on being taken to see his brother despite the circumstances, demonstrating concern and sincerity.
Walks into Joseph's house and addresses his brother gently, searching for words to comfort him.
Struggles emotionally, breaks down, admits 'I don't know if I can do that' when asked to identify the body.
Comforts Joseph by holding him tightly and expressing desire to stay close, showing emotional support and presence.
Gives a fiery stare and confronts the cops with tough, direct questions about their progress in catching the suspects.
Senses uncertainty from the cops, showing awareness of their hesitation or lack of solid leads.
Presses the detectives to find the location of the anticipated big deal, demonstrating persistence and focus on the key objective.
Becomes emotional while urging the cops to find the spot, indicating a moment of personal conflict but still maintaining his drive.
Observes Joseph carefully as he recommits to leading after the funeral, showing attentiveness and patience.
Puts his arm around Joseph's waist in a moment of grief and vulnerability.
Expresses emotional pain and regret out loud during a raw, honest moment.
Expresses a sincere desire to help after family tragedy; wants to join police despite being a civilian.
Offers emotional support by putting arm around his brother Joseph at the gravesite.
Accepts the police commissioner's oath, showing readiness to take responsibility and serve.
Physically transforms by adopting a formal uniform, clean-shaven look indicating a serious, disciplined approach.
Sinks to the couch, picks up a drink after emotional interaction, possibly indicating vulnerability or loss of control.
Politely thanks fellow officers who greet him upon joining the force.
Takes oath seriously, showing commitment to duty and others' safety.
Pledges to support and defend the Constitution and to faithfully discharge his duties.
Receives his gun and badge and confidently enters the police muster room, greeting fellow officers.
Pauses and takes a breath before entering the muster room, showing composure and readiness.
Thanks the officer politely and acknowledges a call from Rosario Diaz.
Focuses on and shows concern about his brother's behavior.
Requests privacy from the group to talk to his brother amidst an emotionally charged situation.
Agrees politely to meet Marat's father-in-law upstairs.
Shares feelings about Rosario leaving, showing vulnerability and openness.
Listens quietly while Louis talks about Rosario and the difficult place she was in, indicating restraint despite provocation.
Agreeing to meet Eli Mirichenko's father-in-law upstairs politely and without hesitation.
Hesitating when asked about Rosario's absence, showing emotional vulnerability but still communicates honestly.
Internalizing and freezing briefly at Louis Falsetti's words, showing emotional disturbance and momentary loss of composure.
Confidently challenges the idea of calling in the Feds by pointing out their limited true experience, showing critical thinking and wit.
Reinforces commitment to seeing the operation through themselves, demonstrating confidence and reliability within the group.
Arrives with Joseph and skillfully moves into position with other cops, prepared for the operation with ear pieces to gather intelligence.
Grabs his brother's arm and confidently says 'We're gonna get all of `em today,' showing confidence and readiness.
Shows emotional reaction (devastation) silently upon seeing Marat and Vadim together, momentarily distracted by the closeness of the enemies.
Commands the suspects to surrender with hands on heads, showing control and authority.
Moves cautiously alongside his partner toward a dangerous situation involving children and gunfire.
Looks back immediately for his brother amidst chaos and gunfire, indicating care and concern.
Stops to identify Michael Solo and avoids shooting him, showing restraint and caution in a dangerous situation.
Coordinates with teammates via radio to ensure everyone's safety during the operation.
Instructs to burn the weeds after confirming all officers are safe, demonstrating decisiveness and care for the team's security.
Stands his ground while all other officers back up.
Decides independently to enter a dangerous fire area to pursue a suspect.
Methodically and skillfully navigates through fire and smoke, assessing unnatural smoke patterns to locate the suspect.
Successfully shoots and neutralizes the armed suspect in a high-risk, split-second situation.
Crouches down and stays close by his brother Joseph, showing presence and support.
Greets fellow officers warmly, responds casually and amiably to their admiration and greetings.
Declines to engage in talk about promotion immediately, suggesting a focus on the moment and family.
Expresses happiness upon seeing someone he cares about, openly responds to Joseph's declaration of love with sincerity.
Scans the room attentively during the ceremony, remains composed despite emotional turmoil.
Momentarily confuses a woman with someone he knows, showing emotional distraction.
